website_summaries.verdict: Simple security that's small enough to fit in a drawer or other compact space.
pros: Works with electronic keypad or manual key

website_summaries.verdict: Good investment for gun owners with smaller children in the home, and those who take prescription medications. Also works as a portable safe during emergency evacuations.
pros: Fits well in desk drawers and nightstands, but still holds several firearms or medication bottles
Better for hidden locations with easy access
cons: Unmodified versions can be opened with a paper clip

customer_reviews.title: All black newer version worth the added cost.
customer_reviews.text: The all black exclusive to Prime members version has a couple of solid updates. The key is not a barrel key so it isn't easy to pick the lock as in previous versions. The button beep sound can be turned off as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little safe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little safe. keeps my meds and important papers locked up, fits perfect inside the top draw of my sauder desk. Only gripe is the battery compartment is flimsy, if the door slams shut by accident the batteries can become loose and then a key is needed. I fixed it by placing foam molding tape on the inside of the battery cover then placing some a strip of Electrical tape to keep it closed. So if the door now slams shut the foam will Absorbe the impact and the tape will keep the lit on tight.
customer_reviews.author: b wolf

customer_reviews.title: Bolt Malfunction, Opens Without Combination
customer_reviews.text: I have had the safe about a month. I opened it today and when I closed it, the safe will not stay locked. It will open without using the combination. There is no way to lock it with the key only. Stack-on is recalling all of their “Sentinel” safes right now for the same “bolt malfunction.” Even if they are able to fix it, I have lost faith in this company and will no longer use their products.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great safe A+++++
customer_reviews.text: We got this case for our guns as we have toddlers. It has a keypad thats battery operated but just incase the battery dies , it comes with two keys . I read allot of reviews and wasn't sure if I should buy or not but I most say we are pleased . There's a review that states that you could open the lock with a paper clip. Well we try it for ourself and it DID NOT OPEN WITH A PAPER CLIP. I give this drawer safe a 5 star review
customer_reviews.author: Angie R

customer_reviews.title: A Great Little Safe
customer_reviews.text: This safe is heavy and well made, especially considering the reasonable price (about $40). This is my second Stack-On safe and their products seem to punch well above their weight. The key code system is easy to set and works well. The batteries are secured much better than other electronic safes I have owned (some much higher priced). Additionally, the key code is easy to input and the door is easy to open quickly as a result of an easy-to-use latch system. The safe will easily fit a large handgun or...whatever. In other words, if you want to secure some things this safe is good. If things go south and you need to do business immediately this safe is good.
customer_reviews.author: Roanoke9000

customer_reviews.title: repeat the process and the key bad functions after removing and installing the batteries
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine today. Seems I have the same keypad issue as some of the other reviewers: I use key to initially open safe, then installed batteries, then pressed red button until it beeped, then entered security code and pressed "#". Tested new security code with the door open and it worked. Closed door, and the key pad doesn't even beep when I press the keys, nadda, nothing. I can however, repeat the process and the key bad functions after removing and installing the batteries, but I can't seem to get past the first successful code attempt; the second attempt is when the key pad just seems to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: A-Duders

customer_reviews.title: Obviously mine didn't go through quality control
customer_reviews.text: I must have received a defective unit. After setting everything up with my pin etc, I find that the locking mechanism opens freely without my pin. I thought it was possibly due to the first procedure of opening the safe; however, when I picked the safe up to move it, I hear some plastic pieces rolling around inside the safe door. Sending back to Amazon and just going with a different brand. I won't risk my daughter reaching the safe in my drawer and potentially hurting herself or others just to save a few dollars. Rather go with a quality built safe and reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Infante

customer_reviews.title: Can be opened by simply bumping it on a bed while rotating knob. Useless!!!
customer_reviews.text: True story. Was unable to open because battery inside went bad. I lost key long time ago. Went on YouTube and there is video showing 10 year old kid opening that safe by simply throwing it on a bed and rotating knob at the same time. After few attempts I was able to open that safe model by simply throwing it one side on a bed while trying to rotate knob at the moment it bounces off the bed, and it WORKED! Unbelivable, all this time I was keeping my valuables in a safe that can be open by simply bumping it on a bed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Telebeep

customer_reviews.title: Responsible Protection for Gun Owners
customer_reviews.text: It is everything advertised - easy to program; silence the beep; quietly open the lock - all while a predator may be 10 feet away! Wonderful way to protect your home at the same time protect your loved ones from accidentally picking up a loaded gun that is ready to shoot an intruder. Of course, money and credit cards fit in this drawer as well, along with jewelry you may want to keep under lock and key. This safe is most affordable and the answer to responsible gun ownership in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Hales

customer_reviews.title: Decent Safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one rather than the updated version strictly on value. While it isn't as pretty and the new one and likely isn't quite as secure, the main purpose is to keep children from getting my house pistol. It works fine, I've put it in bottom of bedside stand drawer. The buttons are easy to use, and you have a choice of audible feedback or not. Of course, for home protection, you don't want the noise. I wouldn't use this type of safe as the primary security to theft, though. I have it behind a double gated, manned security, state of the art home security system, and some obvious visual deterrents outside the home.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but buyer beware. 4 stars.
customer_reviews.text: This safe is great so far, however, when watching how easily it's opened on online videos (and, yes, I tried the techniques myself and sure enough, ...the ways shown DO open the safe easily), it would make me worry if this were used for something other than keeping simple items away from children (unlike guns, or money from burglars). But, since it is used only to keep small items locked away from those that aren't hardened criminals or looking to access darker intent, it's use is practical, sterdy, and a good price. Overall, I would recommend, but watch the online examples first on how easily it's opened so you won't be shocked if it's opened unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.author: Consuelo R. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Keypad stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The keypad on ours stopped working after just a month or so. We contacted Stack-On and used the warranty to get a new one. They were out of this particular product and offered us a bio-metric scanner safe instead. I was happy to accept as those are more expensive and I loved the idea of using my fingerprint (keeps my son out). However, the scanner didn't work either. So now we have two safes that don't work. I'm giving it two-stars because using a key, it works fine (but that's not why I bought it).
customer_reviews.author: Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Keypad no longer opens safe. Inexplicably broken.
customer_reviews.text: Keypad stopped working, correct code can be entered, lights turn green, no "click" to unlock the door. This happened before with this safe, and it somehow started working again, now it's back to not working at a critical time when I need to get into it. It's just been sitting in a dresser drawer, I haven't physically damaged it or anything. Frankly, I'm livid. Spend a little more on a fireproof safe from a different company, I will next time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great. Plenty of room inside
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this to the floor of my 2015 Ram 1500 Express, just in front of the center console. Works and looks great. Plenty of room inside, although I used my own foam and 3M spray adhesive to keep the contents within from rattling around while driving. Also, it blends in great with the black carpet in my truck. I put a black placemat on top of the safe it's almost invisible. I've had passengers not even notice it.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. It only opened smoothly about 70% of the time. Now the batteries are dead and I'm taking a sledge hammer to it. EDIT: I used it several times per month 2 years ago and then seldom since then. So, I suppose I was ignorant of this risk around battery duration.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. After a week or 2, the safe started beeping on its own and wouldn't take the combination .I had to use the key to open the safe and try to rest the combination. Then then the key option was acting up as well. Once I turned the key, the knob still wouldn't turn to open the door. I had to jiggle with it in order for it to work. Once I tried to reset it, it was still acting up. I finally gave up and sent it back for a refund. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Locked and can't open
customer_reviews.text: Locked and key does not work to open it. The key worked prior to door closing. What good is this if you can't open it with the key provided? I had to pay $150 for a locksmith to come out and open the safe due to valuables being still inside. I guess you get what you pay for. DO NOT buy this safe. I don't think this is a reflection on the seller but more so on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean W. Calder

customer_reviews.title: KEY IS STUCK IN LOCK
customer_reviews.text: KEY IS STUCK. Safe was not programmed with digital code. When using key to unlock the safe. the key got stuck after turning around 15 degrees. Cannot take out key or move the lock. Absolutely infuriating. I keep my gun in here to keep my household safe and now it is stuck inside this safe. Calling the manufacture first thing Monday morning.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kim

customer_reviews.title: Solid safe, not paperclip faulty
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It’s heavy and seems sturdy for what’s it’s designed to be. It won’t open with a paper clip either, I’ve already tested that and so did my brother. Keyed lock if needed, coded if you’re using that. Very easy to use and has enough space to fit my SIG 40, two 380’s, and a couple mags for both.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Battery door falls off
customer_reviews.text: I own other stack-on products so I decided to try this. It appeared to be a reasonably priced drawer safe to store a firearm bedside. Unfortunately all the negative reviews are correct. Its amazing how such a little thing like a flawed battery door can have such an impact on a product. But when you rely on that product to be available in a time of need and it doesn't then its not worth much.
customer_reviews.author: damocles

customer_reviews.title: A nice size for a few smaller items
customer_reviews.text: A nice size for a few smaller items. Quick access. My only complaint would be the lid has slammed down on my finger on two occasions. I have now learned to hold the lid open while reaching in for items. We have it mounted flat (lid up). If you have too much stuff inside the lid will not close because it sits down inside the box slightly. Overall, it's a nice little safe.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Meets my expectations of a $50 lock box.
customer_reviews.text: The safe is pretty heavy for it's size and seems well built. It's holding up well for my purpose so no complaints. It's actually too heavy to put in our particular night stand. When I open the drawer beyond a certain point the drawer comes crashing to the floor due to the weight of this thing. So it slides underneath the bed instead. This won't stop a burglar but that's not what I bought it for. The purpose is to stop tiny curious hands from accessing my firearms.
customer_reviews.author: Justin F

customer_reviews.title: Picked this safe because I like the option of muting the button sounds
customer_reviews.text: Picked this safe because I like the option of muting the button sounds. No one is going to touch it but me, so I don't need to alert the whole house that I'm opening the safe. Also, not much point in using the supplied hardware to bolt it to a drawer. You could easily pull the drawer out and smash it free. I bought some longer screws and attached it to some heavy shelving. It will work sufficiently well as long as a thief can't walk away with it and use tools on it at their convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Douglas Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Little Hands Away
customer_reviews.text: Just loaded up my safe, and placed it in the drawer. I like the fact that the latch can remained unlocked, since I plan on keeping it unlocked, unless the grandkids are around... though it seems easy to operate, I don't like the idea of fumbling with the combination, if I need it. I didn't bolt it into the drawer, since I didn't buy it to keep my gun from being stolen. IMO, anyone who sees the safe will have no problem busting it out, if they want it (who puts anything in a safe, unless it was valuable). As I said, this was purchased to keep little hands away - and it seems perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: jgillmet

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, a little big.
customer_reviews.text: While this thing does provide a combination lock box for a gun or other items, I was a little disappointed because it was too thick to go into the drawer of my bedside table. Otherwise it is exactly as advertised, I should have looked at the dimensions and taking a measurement so I can't blame the manufacturer for this, it was my own oversight. Just be sure and review the dimensions before you order this to make sure it fits where you want to put it.
customer_reviews.author: C.Q. Young

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: The safe appears to be of good quality, even very good for the price. It's heavy enough to discourage children from picking it up (if not mounted inside a drawer as recommended). Two keys are provided. The batteries are included. The instructions are very clear and simple to follow. The safe worked exactly as designed. I recommend this product. Only caution is, read the specs to ensure it's the right size for what you want to put inside, and for the drawer you intend to install it in. It's perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Great safe to keep valuables secure.
customer_reviews.text: got this for my son, cause he was always complaining his brothers are stealing his stuff lol. I mainly got it for him to put his important items for safe keeping but needed something small enough to be out of sight and out of mind from prying eyes. He puts his wallet, money, birth certificate, passport and such in there with room to spare. He will be off to college this fall and this was very much needed since he will be sharing a dorm room. So far so good, he hasnt complained anymore so needless to say it must be doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: luvher74

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Heavy drawer safe, lots of interior space, works perfect! ~ great item for it's intended purpose, to keep my one loaded firearm safe from prying eyes and inquisitive hands, but quickly available to me. Listed as CA - DOJ compliant, comes with bolts, batteries & decent instructions too. Children and casual guests SHOULD not be able to tamper with the safe, but a serious thief might just destroy the furniture and steal the entire safe. I recommend a real gun safe bolted to the floor and/or walls for truly valuable "stuff" or a gun collection.
customer_reviews.author: GoldDaze

customer_reviews.title: Fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. I got this in early 2013, and it has worked fine. I tried with a paperclip, and couldn't open, so I believe mine is one w/o the problem. Good! I've had no problems, though I might repl the batteries with new "good ones". I found a hidey-hole I'd like to mount it in, but it's a half inch too deep. Too bad. Another reviewer says to mount it upside down so the door flops down - you can get stuff out one handed and quicker. He also says to drill a couple more holes so you can mount to a stud - not a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kotan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great to store a small gun!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband for Christmas. We have a small gun in the house and I wanted something to keep that out of reach of the children, without it being out of reach for us if we were to need it. We keep this in our end table right by the bed. He had a very easy time setting the password on it. I have practiced opening it a few times and it is easy to use, other than the door is very heavy. That is surprising to me every time. I wish there was a key to it as well, that's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my nightstand drawer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small safe to contain my Glock 19 and one magazine. The opening is a little small and I wish the number pad had a back light but for the price and lead time I cannot complain that much. The safe has some heft to it and when I open the lower drawer of my nightstand where this is house, it causes the nightstand to tilt forward but I am sure that is just dependent on the design of the nightstand itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This safe is great. It is sturdy and I feel like my ...
customer_reviews.text: This safe is great. It is sturdy and I feel like my belongings are secure in it. It was super easy to set up, probably took about 3 minutes. The buttons work well, never stick or give me problems and the 4 digit passcode is perfect. You can get in quickly when needed but it's still long enough so it's not too easy to "guess" the code. And last but not least, it is a great size, it fits everything that I need it to with our being obnoxiously large.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Winterich

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I do with it.
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I intended its use. I wanted something that I could lock up a fire arm in my bedroom that would be quick to open and only meant to keep out young and inquiring minds. I knew this is not something that is going to keep someone from taking the entire safe and opening at a different location, I bolted this to my dresser next to my bed and am satisfied with it operation, I carry often and have opened and closed many times. would recommend to be used as such.
customer_reviews.author: rusticcomfort

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, inexpensive safe. It is reasonably heavy and appears well built. The instructions to program the electronic lock and code are easy to follow. Having the back-up, key entry is nice. The dimensions of the safe are as described. Plenty of room for a full size pistol and a couple magazines or ammunition. It fits well inside a drawer. I have every reason to believe that the prior (several years ago) reports of picking the lock with a paper clip have been corrected and those issues are no longer applicable to this safe.
customer_reviews.author: trsmith

customer_reviews.title: Battery cover is GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: The safe is fine. It does as advertised, HOWEVER, the cover for the battery is GARBAGE! It keeps coming off everytime you close the safe and dropping the battery down the safe, thus, inadvertently locks you out every single time and have to manually open it with the keys. I have to resort in just putting a tape across the cover to prevent it from coming off.

customer_reviews.title: My Second (and last) Try at a Stack-On Product
customer_reviews.text: Have tried two different Stack-On 'drawer' type safes now. First one, was a biometric model. It would not recognize my fingerprints (any of my 10 digits), no matter how many times I reset it. This was a my second try. Product arrived from Amazon (on time, as always with Prime). Removed it from the box and right away I could see, two corners (inside) welds were broken. Tried the keys and found the bolts would not fully retract--hence the door would not open. Swapped keys, multiple times, and with the same result. Never could get the door opened. So, combine the broken welds with a door that won't open = not a product you'd want to try.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredDon2017

customer_reviews.title: Seriously flawed keyed lock design + no customer service = Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: This particular "safe" has a serious design in the keyed lock that allows for children to open it with simple everyday items. I contacted the manufacturer to request a replacement lock, apparently this fixes the issue, and they never returned my email. [...] Search youtube for a detailed description/demonstration of how unsafe this "safe" actually is. Summary: Easily opened lock + Zero Customer Service Support = Zero Stars and Dangerous Safe DO NOT BUY THIS SAFE IF YOU HAVE CHILDREN
customer_reviews.author: Zuesday

customer_reviews.title: Now this this is completely useless. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This this is junk. It never worked from the box. I followed the instructions but the safe would not open with the key provided. The key got stuck in the key slot and would not turn and I could not remove. Within 30 min of trying the key broke off in the slot. Now this this is completely useless. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Altobelli

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and program with my own passcode ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price I don't know if you're going to beat what this safe provides for some peace of mind if you have a few things you don't want hanging out in the open. It was easy to set up and program with my own passcode and I haven't had any problems with it to date. I added additional padding to the inside, but even with that I've been able to put everything in it I've needed to. The only complaint I have is the mechanism you turn after putting your code in feels like really cheap plastic.... but again for the price it's not going to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to fix the unit myself when it stopped unlocking with the keypad.
customer_reviews.text: This should not be used as a security safe. I am using it strictly to keep my carry weapon out of my toddler's hands at home. After a few months, the door started to not unlock when the code was entered. The actuator was not properly retracting. It was getting hung up on the pin bar. I removed the one screw holding the plastic cover on the back of the rear door and adjusted the pin bar for more clearance from the actuator. Now the unit is back to operating correctly. Once again, this unit should not be considered a security safe. It would not keep out a determined teenager.
customer_reviews.author: IamaManHusbandFatherTechie

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. You probably couldn't score a better deal than this really for the price. Has a backup key (that isn't easily picked as some say) keypad with tones when pressed or you can turn off the tones. 3 - 8 digit combos. Good stuff. My 9mm and an extra clip fit in it will. Could also store some cash and maybe a tactical knife or extra shells etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jcnbama

customer_reviews.title: Good Pistol Safe
customer_reviews.text: This safe is perfect for a pistol or 2. It'd be nice if the buttons were a little easier to push, because the frame that they are in kind of gets in the way, but it's not really an issue. You can fit a G19 with 5 mags, and a bg380 with 2 mags comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY BOGLE

customer_reviews.title: Even after reading the reviews I got this and loved it. Use it for gun storage in multiple ...
customer_reviews.text: Even after reading the reviews I got this and loved it. Use it for gun storage in multiple areas of my house. Ended up with 2 one for my kitchen and another for my bedroom. Pros: .Quick access to any valuables or fire arms .Easy to mount .Easy to program/setup Cons: .Could be easily picked using a paper clip .Door can be a little heavy .I wish it were slightly larger.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough to Keep the Cleaning Lady Out...
customer_reviews.text: It is probably a good enough design to keep the cleaning lady or the kids out. It is not going to keep out a professional thief. Would keep a checkbook, credit cards and other replaceable items in it, but need a much better safe for anything you can't easily replace.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Product came within 36 hours. Lightning fast shipping! ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came within 36 hours. Lightning fast shipping! Safe is heavy, solid, well-made. The instructions were concise and well-presented. I bought this safe to keep our young sons (ages 6 and 3) away from our firearms. With the heavy steel gauge construction and the combination lock, there's no way the kids are getting into this safe. Comes with keys in case battery dies. I might even buy another one for downstairs for a convenient place to stage my firearms.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Bruneio

customer_reviews.title: Too late to return it
customer_reviews.text: This safe was great until it started malfunctioning recently. It started flashing lights at me and I wasn’t even pressing any buttons, I tried changing the batteries and it did the same thing. I looked at the manual and tried to reset it but that didn’t even work. Not sure what to do since I missed my return window, I don’t want to have to use the key every time or else I would’ve purchased a different safe. It worked fine up until this point, how am I supposed to get to my weapon if I can’t unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: Put this on the back of mom's headboard where she lives at a senior facility. If she requires emergency transport, I give the code to the EMT on the scene. Inside is a packet with all the papers needed for a rapid hospital admission.
customer_reviews.author: henna

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Safe For The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a small safe for hiding money, phones, papers, guns, or coins. Great little safe to lock firearms up to keep away from young kids. Needs to be bolted solidly to a wall or in a drawer to prevent burglarized theft. It's easy to set your code, and you can make it beep or not when you press the buttons. You can code it up to eight numbers. For the money, this is a great little safe. Watch my review of this safe on Youtube by PsychOtto.
customer_reviews.author: PsychOtto

customer_reviews.title: Good compact safe
customer_reviews.text: Won’t stop a determined thief, but will keep some small valuables reasonably secure against casual theft. Fits easily in a drawer for things like petty cash and two bolt holes in the back can be used to secure it in place. There is a plastic cover between the dial and the keypad in case the internal batteries die. Note that the locking mechanism behind the door is pretty bulky, so the internal volume is smaller than the dimensions would lead you to believe. The locking mechanism is just over 1.25 inches deep from the front plate, so you really only have just under 2 inches of usable depth inside.
customer_reviews.author: Tanu501

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Did a lot of research. Pretty good intersection of price and speed bump security. Will hold a full size pistol, 2 micro compact pistols, a 15 rd mag, and 2 boxes of ammo. Unreal.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Better than your wooden drawer!
customer_reviews.text: I would say item meets my need. Feels sturdy enough to keep unauthorized grabby hands, especially if you have children in the house, from getting access to your gun and other small items, to a point. Yes, you can silence the keypad beeps for covert access when intruder(s) are inside your house; HOWEVER, the click the locking mechanism makes as it unlocks is loud enough that it may or may not give away your intention. As I'm sure most us here do, keep your "nightstand protection" in your nightstand/under your pillow OR leave box unlocked before turning in for the night.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Pareko

customer_reviews.title: Great for gun safety and jewelry security
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for jewelry and our gun. We have kids so it is very important for us to keep guns locked up because we hear about accidents all the time. This is easy to use and provides peace of mind and a good spot for jewelry when strangers (such as repair men/women, etc) come over, because you just never know.
customer_reviews.author: Kay14

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, tough lockbox
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Its only drawback is its weight, but since I use it in a drawer it's not really a problem. I needed a dependable lockbox for my medications, and I almost bought one marketed for that purpose. Then I read the reviews, which talked about the flimsy material of one and difficult lock of another. This one seems to be used a lot to store handguns, and it is definitely tough enough to keep anyone out! The locking mechanism is sturdy. but easy to use. It has more than 3 numbers on its code, with a key backup. it's made of metal, and you're not going to wiggle anything loose on this! I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for child safety
customer_reviews.text: If you want something to secure your weapons from burglars, this may not be for you. It is easy to brake the lock with a pin, and yeah you can put some super glue to get rid of that problem but that's at your own risk. We got this to secure a couple of pistols (Glock 17 and a 22. They fit fine and the safety locked with no problem. We got this in order to have a weapon handy if needed, but safe away from our exploring toddler
customer_reviews.author: Xeneize07

customer_reviews.title: Great for Handguns
customer_reviews.text: I love this safe. It can easily fit two handguns in it with extra magazines. Programming was fairly simple and took about 5 minutes from opening up the box until the code was programmed and ready to go. In terms of storing documents, the only way you're going to store documents is to fold standard paper documents in half. You can easily fit your social security card, credit cards in there. I will be purchasing a bigger safe just for my precious documents.
customer_reviews.author: Wathan48

customer_reviews.title: Just slightly more difficult to open then your drawer. No key or combo needed.
customer_reviews.text: First impression I liked it, I'm not a locksmith or safe expert. But there is a major flaw with this. You can open it without a key or knowing the lock code in seconds. No tools needed, just two hands. Pros: It looks good and affordable. Cons: It's not much of a safe when you can open it without tools or damaging it within a couple seconds. Turn it vertical with keypad facing you, drop it from 2 to 3 inches and when it hits the ground turn the knob. Door opens.
customer_reviews.author: Sharky

customer_reviews.title: Great lockbox
customer_reviews.text: I say lockbox because I really don't consider it a safe, not as secure. However I bought it to put in a drawer and lock my gun up and away from children and it does that perfectly. This will not keep your expensive items nor will it protect your important documents from a real theif. However it will keep kids away from your guns and if someone doesn't feel like breaking the lockbox it will keep eveything secure. There are aftermarket or clone versions of this safe not made by stack-on howover its been said that these do not allow you to turn the beeping noise off. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Denson

customer_reviews.title: If you need a small safe, pick this one up!
customer_reviews.text: Great little safe! Even though it's the older one. It's seems pretty heavy duty and compact. Perfect! It's the right size for money and other important papers. Pick this one up if you need to throw a safe in your center console (in your vehicle) or you just need something small for a drawer. Comes with batteries, and the electronics seem pretty solid. At least for around $40. The only thing I don't like is the plastic piece you need to pull of to use the keys that come with it. It would have been nice if it swiveled around, or clicked.. Other than that, awesome little safe!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Not a good gun safe. EDIT: Can be fixed
customer_reviews.text: I relied on the reviews and it seemed like a good product to purchase. I have had it for almost year and worked just fine, then today I read on Wired that it is vulnerable to a paperclip. From what the wired article had shown a wide variety of their safes are vulnerable. I checked with a paperclip and it opened right away. The hardest part was getting the plastic facade away from the key hole as you can see with my video. UPDATE: After contacting stack-on about the issue I received a replacement lock to fix the problem. Lock took 10 minutes to replace and isn't as vulnerable to issues.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hook

customer_reviews.title: Great gun Safe.
customer_reviews.text: I keep my 9mm handgun and some important documents in this. I have enough room for another handgun (which I'l be purchasing and it will be a .45). I guess previous version had the easy unlock with a paperclip issue but this "updated" version doesn't seem to. No issues and keeps my handgun secure. Even tho my handgun is in there, I still teach my kids about handgun safety and what NOT to do as well as they should not be touched and played with as a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Jlee

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the nay-sayers!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent gun safe. It fits our SA XD 9mm and Bersa 380 with room to spare. Not sure why the OLD reviews always end up being first to be read. Stack-On fixed the paper clip lock pick ages ago. This was simple to program, easy to install and bolt down, and not sure why I hesitated so long in getting this. Ignore the nay-sayers, buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Favorite Old Thing

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and is very well made and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Have not had any of the issues that some people said they had. Have not tried breaking in with a paperclip. Seems very well made. Due to the locking mechanism, the interior dimensions are tight so make sure you're aware of that from the start. I am using this for a handgun and that fits fine. Fits into a typical desk side drawer just fine, but even though you can bolt it to the drawer someone could just remove the drawer with the safe in it so I had to modify my drawer so it was not removable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Skiba

customer_reviews.title: For some reason the beeping keeps turning itself back on
customer_reviews.text: The default for this safe is a series of fairly loud beeps when you press buttons on the keypad. There is an option to turn off the beeping with a series of keypresses, but for some reason the beeping seems to turn itself back on after a while. It's bizarre and kind of annoying. Otherwise it's a decent safe. Plenty of room for a handgun and some mags, and maybe some vital docs as well if they are folded. There are some holes in the bottom to mount it to some furniture or the floor, and you'll probably want to do that because it's fairly light. I'd recommend it unhesitatingly, if not for that damn beeping.
customer_reviews.author: Ouze

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, junk lock mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from a name like stack on. Set up easily enough. Installed on a shelf. Hit the keys to put my handgun inside and the lock mechanism would only half half open. Tried a dozen times with the same effect. Finally had to use the keys. If I needed to get to my gun in an emergency I would’ve been helpless. Seems to be working fine now, but how can I trust it won’t do this again, and what if that time is when I need it?
customer_reviews.author: TJMack20

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This safe surpassed my expectations by far. It's large, tough, sturdy and secure. I was considering higher-priced GunVault safes but the reviews were mixed. I stumbled onto this one while browsing other options and I'm glad I did. For half the price of competitors, this is a great safe in every way. The electronic lock mechanism is easy to program and use, the manual key is a good backup in case you forget your combo or the batteries die, and the safe even provides holes and bolts for mounting. Perfect fit for my Glock 23 and several extra magazines, but there'd be no problem fitting a full-sized pistol and extra mags. Would buy again. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Guy

customer_reviews.title: Small - Secure - Safe.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small secure safe for some personal items. I first saw this safe on You Tube along with others. There were absolutely no complaints from recent buyers. I mentioned that I was looking for a small safe to my son and he replied "You need to try the Stack-On PDS-500. You will like it. I have one if you would like to see it." I did and was sold. The quality is outstanding and the electronic / key alternate lock works perfectly. It is one of the 'best buys' for the money I've ever had. Less than $50, I think. It is very heavy with bolt locks. I would do it again. - j.
customer_reviews.author: J. Long

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice little pistol safe at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little pistol safe at a good price. My goal is simply to make sure that grandchildren (or other visitors) don't get their hands on my firearms. It easily holds my Beretta and my revolver, as well as adequate ammunition. The keypad works well and the locking mechanism is solid. I'm getting another one for the office. Obviously, if your intent is to prevent your gun from being stolen then you need to secure the safe itself, but that is not my issue. I just want to keep them away from the kiddies.
customer_reviews.author: emino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value. Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Value. Easy to set up and use. I have two (one at each residence) and perfect for keeping firearms and valuables away from young family members and their visitors. A thief will carry the whole thing away. So, get a Big Strong Heavy Fireproof Safe for $$$$ if that is what you need. This is perfect for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me...
customer_reviews.text: I can get three guns in this small, portable safe. A full-size S&W MP 40 pistol, a five-shot S&W 38+P revolver, and a Bodyguard 380 pistol. Looks good. Solid. Does what it is designed for (at least for me)... keeps children and visitors away from loaded guns (that can be quickly accessed by the owner with an easy to remember code or key). Keep in mind that a thief could take the box and break in by applying tools / hammers / etc. with properly located brute force or even pick the lock. Again... I want quick access to guns that can be used urgently if needed while protecting any curious children or visitors to my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this safe a try based on the positive reviews it had received. I was also looking at more expensive high quality safes and would have happily spent the money for them if this one didn't really live up to its rep. But, son-of-a-gun, this incredibly reasonably priced product totally delivers on its promise. I'm genuinely delighted that you can get such a rock-solid, functional product at this price-point. I could keep on raving, but I'll cut to the chase: If you want a high quality, heavy-duty, user-friendly safe for valuables or super-secure home-defense handgun storage, this product really lives up to its reviews. Exceeds expectations, period. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Clan Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for secure handgun storage
customer_reviews.text: Great safe, easy to operate and feels incredibly sturdy. My only "dislike" is the thin foam thats provided. This was purchased to house a 9mm, box of ammo and 3 clips, everything fits inside and after I added better foam, my items are better protected. I'd suggest ordering pre-scored customizable foam.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Safe.
customer_reviews.text: Good little safe. I keep my EDC in it. I would like to have foam around the inside walls. I will be add that to avoid accidental scratching of my firearms, extra mags, knife, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Odracir Saripsa

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning right the  first day
customer_reviews.text: The first hour after receiving this safe, the knob to open the safe stopped working with the keypad, you put the code in in the light turns green in the knob only work probably the first four times. Then the only was to open it was the keypad, even after resetting changing batteries etc. Still only the actual key would work so i had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Great first child proof safe
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was wide enough to bolt to a wall better, but I can't complain, it would slow down a their a few minutes and keep my kids out long enough, still pretty easy to open. Wish the key pad lit up but for the price i can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Metalman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: After one month the batteries died (or so I thought) and I went to change them. However, the problem is they keypad not working. I've tried all new batteries multiple times and it just won't work. After only one month I can't return it so now I have to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Valleskey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great Safe. I bought it to keep my carry gun handy so I would remember to take it with me when I leave. Had a flip safe in the garage but walked right by it 90% of time. I bolted the Stack-On Safe to the corner of my desk. Holds 2 guns and my wallet. Now every time I leave or return home the pistol is right there with my wallet and money clip.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The safe does exactly what I want it to. It keeps my gun safe from my grandchild, yet close enough to access. Others say u can open it with a paper clip? I can't do it, and there is a cover over the keyhole anyway. For added security, mine is mounted on the wall behind the curtains. Plenty of room for my Glock and 3 clips, plus extra bullets. Is it jewel-thief safe? Probably not. But it serves my purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: maha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.  Great for handguns
customer_reviews.text: Fits drawer perfectly. $15 cheaper than identical item in store and with 2 day prime shipping. Pretty easy to enter code and this safe does not feel cheap like some do. Holds two 9mm guns with clips easily. Takes about 5-6 sec to have gun in hand so pretty easy to operate. Going to buy another for the wife’s nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty and easy to operate—but not that quick on the draw
customer_reviews.text: This safe seems plenty stout for my purpose of keeping the grandkids out of harm's way. I don't know that I'd refer to it as "quick access," since you have to enter the code and then turn the knob and pull the door open. It also wouldn't interfere with a determined thief. But as I say, as a solution to keep children or others away from your bedside firearm, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect child proof solution
customer_reviews.text: This little jewel is just the right size for any pistol up to a government 1911. It will even allow for two small .380's to be secured. The door bolts very securely with two steel pins; and is very heavy. This a solid little safe that can be put up on a mid-wall shelf; or in a nightstand or dresser drawer; or, in some cases, even slid under a high bed frame. It also has two pre-drilled holes that would allow for lag-bolting to a wall stud. Four quick combination numerals, and it easily snaps open. I am really pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Islandgolfer

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Even though brand new, the safe I received was not working and seems the digital box in it was broken. Terrible build and quality control. Even at this price point, this item is a waste of money. The overall feel was cheap and flimsy. I would spend a little more and get something with better construction quality and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: First one I bought was defective - it didn't lock the safe at all. I believe the mechanism wasn't working. I called amazon and they overnight-ed a new one. Not a bad safe for the money you are paying. Primarily purchased to keep my daughter away from my gun. If a burglar wanted to take this safe from my house, it is very possible - please keep that in mind! I bolted the safe to the bottom of the drawer with different screws from what arrived.
customer_reviews.author: bakeredout

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY THIRD ONE AND I JUST LOVE. IF YOU HAVE GRANDKIDS AROUND THIS IS THE BEST TO STORE YOUR PISTOL AND OTHER THINGS OUT OF REACH.
customer_reviews.author: charles h hazelwood

customer_reviews.title: Stack on PDS-500 does the job
customer_reviews.text: Initial set up was very simple and took just a few minutes to complete. The PDS-500 is extremely well built and rugged considering the price I paid. Installed the safe into a dresser drawer, and for extra theft deterrent I took a computer security cable and wired it from one of the mounting bolts to the dresser frame, along with notching the screw end threads. The PDS-500 has just enough space to lock up what I have in stock for home defense. I also mounted theI had previously purchased from AZ into the drawer for night access-if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wetherill

customer_reviews.title: Good security for the price
customer_reviews.text: This safe is sturdy enough to keep your valuables fairly safe. If you have children in the house, I would not recommend this for securing handguns, as there are 2 or 3 different ways of getting into this safe, which are comon to safes in this price range. Any child could get in, if they have access to YouTube. Bolting this safe to a solid location, preferably hidden, and moving the red code reset button may make it more difficult, but not impossible to get in. If you need more security, be prepared to spend a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalTim

customer_reviews.title: Locking mech and design seem great. Working perfectly after a couple months of daily ...
customer_reviews.text: Locking mech and design seem great. Working perfectly after a couple months of daily use. Only small complaint is how much space the lid takes up due to it housing the locking device and electronics. The lid is "deep" and you have to make sure what goes in the safe is not too tall or it won't be able to shut/lock. Keep this in mind and consider what you'll be storing in the safe.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K. Lounsbury

customer_reviews.title: Works fine and mine won't open with a paperclip
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and mine won't open with a paperclip. Hopefully they have that problem solved. But either way, I figure this was never designed to stop a determined thief with enough time to steal it. It is to keep my gun out of someone's hands.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great quick access safe for a low price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a safe that will keep out a thief, than this is not the safe to buy. If you're looking for a great little safe to have quick access to (A hand gun let's say) and keep young kids out (Probably under 8 or so) than this is a fantastic little safe to have in/on your nightstand. The safe can hold a decent sized hand gun and a couple/few mags along with some smaller items if you want. It's not the best...but for the price it certainly is phenomenal and serves the purpose I need it for; in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Madmax1

customer_reviews.title: effectively making the safe useless. I would return the item and rate 0 ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this back in July, shortly after using this safe the electrical was having issues because the back panel inside the safe would bulge out and the batteries would lose contact with the leads. Had to manually open safe 3x and reseat leads and batteries and properly shut panel. Now the top 3 buttons (number 1, 2 and 3) do not register, effectively making the safe useless. I would return the item and rate 0 stars if possible but I did not keep the box and not sure whether the vendor will take a return 6 months after purchase date.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad J. Baba

customer_reviews.title: Nice little safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good little safe. Fits right into the drawer and can be accessed quickly. I also like being able to disable the beeping sound while keying in the code. I have enough room for two boxes of ammo, two magazines, and my pistol. The locking mechanism is manually actuated by turning the knob after entering your code. I bought this thing as a place to keep my pistol out of curious hands- not to stop a thief. Obviously any safe that isn't bolted into the wall/floor is going to be subject to thievery. It would look a little awkward, though, to have a 500 lb gun safe as your bedside table.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R

customer_reviews.title: Great way to secure and access valuables
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy to use. Has a nice silence feature (so a beep doesn't happen when you enter the numbers). Forget the biometric locks - they suck (I had one). Biometric technology does not work well at this price point. So unless you want to spend thousands on a biometric lock, go for the tried and true digital keypad. This device does come with two holes in the bottom to secure it to the floor. I wish it came with a side hole so I could connect a security chain/lock. I prefer to not drill holes in my floor
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get in to without a key
customer_reviews.text: This safe by all appearance looks really good and functions as to be expected. I keep things that should not be around kids in it. During my last move the keys disappeared and today my batteries died. Thought I was in trouble. Little did I know that a simple paperclip wiggled in it would be enough to turn the lock. My kids are still really young but this safe will be replaced now to avoid any chance of an accident. If you have older kids and want them to not have access to what is inside, choose another safe company!!! Would never recommend if you have children.....
customer_reviews.author: JBower

customer_reviews.title: Good size ... Great price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this little safe can't be beat. Unfortunately, it didn't fit into any drawer that I have available. I question the rationale of bolting it into a drawer that's removable anyway ... if someone's going to take the safe, they'll simply take the drawer that it's attached to and deal with it later. Anyway, I've bolted mine to a wall in a closet and attached one of those inexpensive battery-operated "press-lights" inside for some illumination. I can fit a S&W 357 w/4" barrel inside. Just have to remember to turn the light off before I close it up.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Faulty sound control
customer_reviews.text: I love this product in general, and this is my second purchase of this unit because the first has worked so well. However: the "silence mode" that allows you to access the contents of the safe without beeping at every button push (5 required to open the unit) is not working on my second unit. This means that if I ever needed to open this quietly...instead I'd be broadcasting my location and activity. I am going to contact the manufacturer, but in the meantime the usefulness of this item is greatly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Knight

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Great drawer safe. I keep revolver in wallet holster and a box of .38 rounds in this and it fits easily. No worries with my grandkids roaming the house.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this right after I made my first handgun purchase, it works great so far it fits my XD 40 S&W and a few other items, the electronic lock works great and so does the hidden key lock under the center panel, In my opinion it would be difficult for any small child to be able to get into this safe. The one downside would be that the backside of the safe door is bulky, so you're not able to put too many wide objects inside. I mainly keep my handgun with paperwork, passports etc. Overall still a good purchase would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Inexpensive Safe with Electronic Lock
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these safes, but needed a third. This one has been improved over the first two, although all three are great ways to story valuables or handguns. They are easy and quick to open and having keys as backups for when the batteries run down is also a nice touch. I will likely order another one of these in the future as my gun collection grows.
customer_reviews.author: Bassman

customer_reviews.title: Trust me it works!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works REALLY well! Just don't lose the key and mess-up on the electronic code. We kept my husband's medication in the safe. We lost the key during a move, and we messed up the code 3 times (which locks you out.) We had to pay a locksmith (not many will open safes for obvious reasons) to get the medication out. He had one HELL of a time getting it opened. It is an awesome safe that I highly recommend, but make sure you keep your code and key somewhere safe. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Barry

customer_reviews.title: A little small safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought the safe to hold precious metals. It is very limited on space so if you need more space than what a little pistol would hold you don't want this product. It was easy assembly in the drawer with bolt holes pre-drilled and the safe is easy to use. There is a back up key just in case. The best choice to secure it is a built in shelf. The drawer can easily be taken out and a robber still abscond with your valuables. But is would keep a child out if they don't know the combination. I would purchase again but I would like to have had a little more inside space.
customer_reviews.author: Songbird

customer_reviews.title: For the money, a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in a standard desk drawer. Excellent height/depth. Door is not spring loaded for quick access, but it is easy enough to lift open the door after inputting the code. A spring loaded door similar to my other single unit personal safes would be nice, but for the price paid, I am not complaining. Not made as a fully secure safe, rather to keep children away from your firearm, while maintaining accessibility at your desk if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marvel Fan

product_meta.title: Stack-On PDS-1500 Drawer Safe with Electronic Lock
product_meta.description: Color:Black LockGreat security for pistols, ammo and valuables at home, on the road or in the office. Solid steel, pry resistant, plate steel doors, steel live action locking bolts and concealed hinges provide greater security. The electronic lock includes a dashboard faceplate that makes it easy to view the status of your safe. The key pad will "beep" when a button is touched- letting you know you have pressed a key. The "beeps" can be turned off or on with the press of the megaphone button. There is a time out period after 3 incorrect combination attempts. Your safe includes a backup key should your batteries lose power or if you forget your combination. Combinations can be changed easily by pressing a button located on the back of the door and entering a new combination. There are pre-drilled holes for mounting the safe to the floor/shelf and wall. Fastening hardware is included. Safes should be mounted to a solid surface to ensure the security of their contents. These safes are California-approved Firearm Safety Devices that meet the requirements of Penal Code section 23655 and the regulations issued thereunder.
feature_bullets: Perfect size to fit inside of a drawer
2 live action steel locking bolts and concealed hinges for greater security
Time out period after 3 incorrect combination attempts
Pre-drilled holes for mounting the safe to the floor/shelf and wall, fastening hardware is included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,126 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
